Klasse Book

java.lang.Object
de.fherfurt.librarySystem.models.Book
Alle implementierten Schnittstellen:
Cloneable, Comparable<Book>
public class Book extends Object implements Comparable<Book>, Cloneable
The Book class represents a book consisting of ID, title, author, genre, isDamaged, isBorrowed, personBorrowed, borrowDate, feeForOneWeek and feeForDamagedBook. Also implements Comparable and Cloneable.
Siehe auch:
  • Comparable
  • Cloneable

  • Konstruktordetails

    • Book

      public Book(String title, String author, String genre, boolean isDamaged)
      Creates a new book with the given attributes. The book ID is automatically assigned based on a counter.
      Parameter:
      title - The title of the book.
      author - The author of the book.
      genre - The genre of the book.
      isDamaged - Indicates whether the book is damaged.

    • setDamaged

      public void setDamaged(boolean damaged)
      Sets the damage status of the book. If the book is already marked as damaged, the method does nothing.
      Parameter:
      damaged - A boolean indicating whether the book should be marked as damaged.

    • setGenre

      public void setGenre(String genre)

    • setBorrow

      public void setBorrow(Person personBorrowed)
      Sets the book as borrowed and saves the current date as the borrow date.
      Parameter:
      personBorrowed - The person who is borrowing the book.

    • setBorrow

      public void setBorrow(Person personBorrowed, LocalDate borrowDate)
      Marks the book as borrowed and sets a specific borrow date. This method allows setting a custom borrow date, and is primarily intended for testing purposes.
      Parameter:
      personBorrowed - The person who is borrowing the book.
      borrowDate - The date on which the book should be marked as borrowed.

    • removeBorrow

      public void removeBorrow()
      Removes the borrow status from the book, making it available again for borrowing. Resets the borrow date and the person who borrowed the book.

    • setBorrowed

      public void setBorrowed(boolean borrowed)

    • compareTo

      public int compareTo(Book otherBook)
      Compares this book to another book based on title, author and their unique identifier (ID). If titles are different, they are compared alphabetically. If titles are the same, authors are compared alphabetically. If both are the same, IDs are compared numerically.
      Angegeben von:
      compareTo in Schnittstelle Comparable<Book>
      Parameter:
      otherBook - The book to compare to.
      Gibt zurück:
      A negative integer, zero, or a positive integer if this book's title is less than, equal to, or greater than the other book's title.

    • clone

      protected Book clone() throws CloneNotSupportedException
      Creates a clone of this book. The clone is a shallow copy of the original book.
      Setzt außer Kraft:
      clone in Klasse Object
      Gibt zurück:
      a cloned Book object
      Löst aus:
      CloneNotSupportedException
